column4: syria, often your Apache logs have the answer for that kind of problem. access.log and error.log both.
Thnx, I will see whats going on there.
sudo tail -f /var/log/apache2/error.log then reproduce the problem and watch the log in realtime :)
nothing scary in there, you might have to dig in the access log to figure out what's going on
I also see an "other_vhosts_access.log" which your webserver might be writing too, I'm not sure of your config
check both of those if they exist, tail -f while reproducing the problem to make the correlation if possible
is this one helpful http://paste.ubuntu.com/584186/ ? this the access.log
I can't troubleshoot your php app for you, but I bet the info you need might be in that access log, since it's showing your pages loading. Good luck.
Just one more question please. removing phpmyadmin and re-installing it can solve the problem?
try it and find out, I guess. One more tip: don't be root in the terminal. Use sudo for things that require root privileges in the terminal.
i have removed phpmyadmin using this command apt-get purge-- remove phpmyadmin and after installing it again i couldn't login. :(
the phpmyadmin docs are going to be your best resource
or someone else that is running it.
